title: 2 Easy Ways to Back Up Contacts on an Android

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings . You'll usually find it in the app drawer or the notification tray. This method will help you back up all your Android data, including your contacts, to your Google account.

steps.title: Tap Google.
steps.content: Tap Google . You might need to scroll down to see this next to a "G" icon. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings for Google apps.
steps.content: Tap Settings for Google apps . Scroll down to find this option near the bottom of the "Services on this device" section.

steps.title: Tap Google Contacts sync.
steps.content: Tap Google Contacts sync . This is usually near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Also sync device contacts.
steps.content: Tap Also sync device contacts . You'll be directed to a page with a toggle. If it's already on, skip this and the next step.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Automatically back up & sync device contacts" to toggle it on.
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Automatically back up & sync device contacts" to toggle it on. If the switch is already colored and pointing to the right, the feature is enabled. Once it's enabled, you're done! If you toggle the switch on, you can tap the "Backup account" listed to change your Google account. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. If you're using the default Contacts app on most Androids, look for a blue and white icon with an address book or peoples' heads. Use this method to save your contacts as a VCF file that you can access anywhere and not inside a backup.

steps.title: Tap Fix & manage.
steps.content: Tap Fix & manage . It's a tab in the bottom right-hand corner of your screen with the icon of a wrench.

steps.title: Tap Export to file.
steps.content: Tap Export to file . You'll see this tile next to an arrow pointing up.

steps.title: Select the accounts to export (if your phone has multiple accounts).
steps.content: Select the accounts to export (if your phone has multiple accounts). You'll see this if you have a Samsung phone, for example, and have both a Google and Samsung account added. Tap one to select it.

steps.title: Tap Export.
steps.content: Tap Export . It's in the bottom right corner of your screen and will prompt you to choose where to save the .VCF. Save the exported contacts file to an SD card by tapping the three-line menu and selecting the SD card from the menu. Alternatively, you can select your Google Drive or anywhere in your phone's internal storage. When you're done choosing where to save the file, tap Save . [3] X Research source
